result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jackson James Merrill

records.addlTxt:
12:06 PM  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court, with Attorney Daniel Chapman. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty Chapman acknowledged receipt of unfiled information.  Through Counsel DEF entered NG plea.
Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.

11:56 AM Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court, with Attorney Daniel Chapman. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Chapman indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness, LCO Officer Ian Junker, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.    11:59 AM  Witness identified the DEF,  No objection by Attny Chapman, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  12:02 PM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Chapman.  12:04 PM  Attny Chapman no further questions.  12:04 PM Re-direct by State.   Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.     Moves to Arraignment.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:57 AM Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court.  Attorney Daniel Chapman appears by video.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Counts 2 and 3.  Court reviews violation report for Justice Point.   Court addresses DEF regarding violation.  Court requires DEF to make contact with Justice Point today following court.  Through Attorney, DEF requests preliminary hearing within time limits.  Court sets.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Refused to sign his cash/signature bond - 8/8/2022
